inn1.comm: darted in flat to start, the ball dies off the surface and is defended to leg
quicker and flatter still, heading towards leg stump and Kieswetter just needs to get a touch on it to open his account with four to fine leg
Kieswetter begins to come down the track but Dilshan draws the defensive stroke out of the batsman with another fired in delivery
definite turn already! This gripped the surface and took a thick inside edge as Kieswetter thrust forward ... this time it's chased down just before the rope
Dilshan comes round the wicket to Cook, who presses forward in defence
beaten on the outside edge! Cook came forward again but the ball ripped across the face of the bat. Dilshan knows how close that was, he's chewing his nails now
and indeed he does, right on target and Kieswetter defends off the front foot
beaten! This really dribbled through very low, Kieswetter was back and looking to force the ball through the off side, but the ball shot through under the bat
wrong line from Kulasekara, and some inswing takes the ball further down the leg side. Sangakkara dives but can't stop it cleanly
a little more carry on this one as the ball straightens outside off and Kieswetter leaves alone
nipping in off the pitch, and Kieswetter nudges to square leg
shot! This raced to the boundary despite the slowness of the pitch. Full and wide from Kulasekara and Kieswetter swings his arms through the line to send the ball through the covers
some nip off the seam again, coming in to the right-hander, and Kieswetter flicks through square leg for a couple
Cook hops back and attempts to thrash a long-hop through cover, but he hits the fielder
extravagant turn! Cook pushes forward with no great certainty and is beaten on the outside edge
full and straight, tapped into the off side
width offered, Cooks chops to backward point where the fielder dives but can't stop a single
this is loose from Dilshan, spearing the ball down the leg side
very loose indeed! Another ball is looped well down the leg side, and neither the keeper nor the leg slip can stop a bye
cut away to point, and a good diving stop by Jeevan Mendis saves runs
cut off the stumps to point once again
pitched up quite wide outside off, Kieswetter has a look and leaves alone
full again, but straight this time and Kieswetter defends as the ball curls in to him through the air
this is much better from Kulasekara, on a length and straight and Kieswetter defends
Kulasekara pushes one a little wider and Kieswetter flashes outside off, only to be beaten
Kieswetter shimmies down the track and lifts Kulasekara over long-on for the first six of the innings! Great intent from the batsman
Kieswetter ends another good over for England with watchful defence
swept powerfully to long leg. a shot of great authority from Cook to start the over
Cook comes forward and punches into the covers
heaved into the deep! Cook bends into a slog sweep and the ball flies towards the midwicket boundary ... but plugs in the slow outfield, and is stopped a couple of feet from the rope
filthy, filthy stuff from Dilshan. Flung well down the leg side, again the ball flies between keeper and leg slip and this time it's five wides
full and straight, tapped back to the bowler
this was heading down the leg side too, but kept a little low as Kieswetter looked to clip to leg
full outside off, Kieswetter nudges to point
Kulasekara keeps it full, Cook defends
pushed a little wider, some movement takes the ball away from Cook and he's beaten on the outside edge
straighter, more defence from Cook
there's an optimistic shout for lbw as Cook is struck on the pad, but that's pitched outside leg and they take a leg bye
deft little shot from Kieswetter, waiting on the ball and angling it very fine down to third man ... where it's fielded by Malinga
guided down to third man for another
Malinga hits a length on off stump and Kieswetter comes half forward in defence
some movement away from the bat off the pitch, Kieswetter uses it to pick up a single to third man
shot! Malinga offers width and a long half-volley, and Cook leans into a neat drive that sends the ball skidding to the cover boundary
low bounce again, Cook was looking to nudge off the hip but is rapped on the pad. No appeal, it had pitched well outside leg
well, a great delivery but it's still cost three runs! Malinga attacks the stumps and gets the ball to jag in to Cook off the seam, taking a thick inside edge and running to fine leg
full and quite wide, Kieswetter opens the face of the bat for yet another single to third man
Kulasekara goes very full, the ball dipping and swinging past Kieswetter's bat to spark an appeal ... but that was headed well down the leg side
slipping towards leg once again, but this time it's a leg-stump half-volley and Kieswetter muscles it to the deep midwicket boundary. My, Sri Lanka have been fairly atrocious this morning.
dropped by Sangakkara! Kieswetter was aiming to angle the ball down to third man but it straightened on him, taking a thin edge. Sangakkara is up to the stumps, and can't hold onto the edge
defended back down the track
four more! Another hit-me ball on leg stump, and Kieswetter thrashes it to the wide long-on boundary four his fourth four
glanced to fine leg, and they're back for the second
clipped firmly into the leg side, but a diving short midwicket stops the runs
short outside off, Cook leans back and pounds a cut in front of point, four more. You don't bowl there to Alastair Cook ...
punched through cover, three more! The ball is coming on nicely with Malinga's extra pace, Cook just leans half forward and pushes through the line, threading the gap between cover and mid-off
bouncer! This may not be the bounciest pitch, but Malinga can still extract some life from it and Kieswetter has to sway quickly out of the way
square-driven with style! Malinga offers width and a driveable length, and Kieswetter accepts, beating point and taking England into the 70s. Slow pitch? What slow pitch?
angling down the leg side, Kieswetter can't lay bat on the glance
decent start, on a length and straight, and it's tapped back to the bowler
Prasad slips towards Cook's pads and is flicked through the leg side for a couple
Prasad finds the edge of Cook's bat, but the ball flies through the vacant slip area down to third man
Prasad hits a good length once again, Kieswetter nudges to that man at midwicket
tight line on off stump, and more defence from Kieswetter. Prasad has been impressive so far, especially considering this is his first game of the tour
slightly fuller, Kieswetter comes forward and defends to cover point
good steady start from Randiv around off stump, hint of turn. Cook blocks
little bit of extra bounce finds the top edge as Cook sweeps. It loops one-bounce to deep square, who trips comically as he runs into field
Kieswetter is striking the ball very sweetly this morning and cracks this to long-off
dabbed with soft hands to deep mid-on. England can happily milk singles after the start they've had
shortish ball is pulled without much power around the corner. Jayawardene fields uneasily but keeps it to one
Cook prods a single into the leg side. Randiv, who is no great spinner of the ball admittedly, found less turn then Dilshan did in the first couple of overs
little bit short from Prasad and on the hip too, Cook shovels a single to midwicket
huge appeal from bowler and wicketkeeper but umpire wasn't at all interested. It looked very close on replay and Hawk Eye has it clipping
Cook heaves a drive without much timing to mid-off
a little bit short and wide, feeding Cook's favourite cut shot, thankfully for the bowler there is a deep point in place
full and straight, haven't seen much of that this morning. Kieswetter defends with an inside edge to midwicket
dot ball to finish makes that a rare good over for Sri Lanka. Just another 10 and we might be level again
short ball is crashed straight to point
this is struck as hard but as a sweep shot, again straight to the fielder
this time Cook beats the infield with a sweep, fetching it down to deep fine leg
Randiv is bowling quite quick and flat, preventing Kieswetter from advancing. Instead it's knocked around the corner

all over for Cook! Very positive move to take the batting Powerplay but he's undone by Randiv here. Cook runs down the wicket, aims a big heave but some big turn leaves him stranded. Sangakkara has an age to take the bails off but it's been a positive start from Cook
Trott carefully blocks his first ball
Kieswetter steers his from just outside his off stump to deep third man

Kieswetter gone now! It's an England Powerplay special! This kept a touch low but it was fullish and straight and burst through Kieswetter's defences to rattle the stumps. Prasad is delirious and has every right to be!

play and a miss outside off stump! Prasad is playing a blinder here. Loose shot from Pietersen, flashing a drive at thin air. Sri Lanka, finally, seem to be alive and eager. They've been sleeping all morning until now
Pietersen hurries down the wicket to aim a leg-side flick. Gets little more than an inside edge but his quick feet get him two
top bowling from Prasad. Pietersen was advancing and looking to play leg side so the bowler hammered in it a touch shorter and outside off. Pietersen had to adjust late to defend
slower ball this time to counter Pietersen's advance. Delivered it well and the batsman ended up nudging a single to leg
Randiv loops up a slow spinner that Pietersen casually dips down the ground
no turn outside off stump and Trott is forward in sturdy defence
this sticks in the wicket a touch and Trott almost ends up popping a return catch to the bowler
Trott clips a single down the ground to get himself off the mark
no messing from Pietersen, he's down the wicket straight away and exchanging a single with Trott
solid clump back past the bowler to steal the strike
Prasad is just a touch quicker than he looks and Trott's drive is rushed. Not timed
plenty of width on offer here but Trott's drive is mistimed and picks out cover
good line from Prasad, outside off stump, preventing Trott's nudge-to-leg release shot
this time Trott hurries well across his off stump to fiddle to leg. Does it well enough to bring Pietersen back on strike
Pietersen falls! Sri Lanka are right back in this now! Extra bounce was the key. Outside off, Pietersen aimed a back-foot drive but could only succeed in edging behind
big, broad smile from Prasad after he welcomes Morgan with a sharp bouncer! Prasad is fast-becoming my favourite of all things!
Trott eases a wide delivery to cover
good from Trott, running this off the face to third man
Kulasekara looks more comfortable now and finds a decent line outside off stump
served up very full and a touch wide, Morgan laces his cover drive but there is a man out
yorker landed here, Trott digs it out
...it's blocked to cover to make that 14 for 3 from the 5-over Powerplay. Still think it was sound thinking, not sure Pietersen played it very smartly
this keeps very low and the line is on off stump. Morgan is careful in defence

again Morgan is very cautious in defence. He's not trusting this pitch much. But low-scoring scraps are the sort of games England like and after the start Cook, Kieswetter and Sri Lanka gave them they are still in a good position
for no good reason, point tumbles past a routine stop to allow Morgan a single where he shouldn't have had one
flourish from Trott! Real exotic, up on one-leg flip from a shortish ball finds the gap and runs away for four
Prasad's response is not textbook, not a good textbook at least. Very wide outside off
neatly driven through cover
good end to a mixed over from the bowler with Morgan defending
steered with an open face to third man
huge appeal from Kulasekara as this finds pad and bat around off stump. Bowler thought pad first, umpire thought bat and replay shows Billy has done well
good stop at mid-off by Chandimal means Trott's well-timed drive gets one instead of four
another spill from a diving point fielder allows Morgan a single
another Kulasekara slower ball. Trott is fairly unmoved and nudges away a single
lovely late dab earns Morgan a single to make that six in the over
banged in a touch shorter, Morgan wheels away a pull shot with some timing, not a lot but it heads out to fine leg nonetheless
Trott pushes to cover but picks out a fielder
this time a forcing drive pierces the infield but a sweeper on the cover boundary tidies up
Morgan is very careful. Another head-over-ball drive, placing it into a gap
on the pads Trott will help himself every time. Clips neatly but is denied four by a slow outfield combining with a tumbling stop
very solid from Morgan in defence
much better to begin. Starts on a length around off stump. Trott blocks
good lengths and lines here and quietly defended
swinging down the leg side, Trott clipped to fine leg where Prasad made a brilliantly comical stop, falling on the ball. I love that guy
steered away for a quick single
this sticks in the wicket a touch and Morgan's flick goes in the air over midwicket
driven to cover to end another slightly disappointing over from Malinga

excellent work from Morgan, skipping down the wicket and flicking off his toes behind square on the leg side. Sri Lanka's fielding today has been appalling and Malinga continues the trend by missing his sliding stop
Trott is moving along very nicely now. Jayawardene-like stealth, but without any of the elegance
with the softest of paws Morgan fiddles to the leg side
ah brilliant work from Trott. Just a simple straight drive but the timing is so good. Beats the bowler and hurries away. Kulasekara is having a mare
this time it's defended quietly
Trott pushes to mid-on and uses his less-than-perfect timing to pinch a single
excellent yorker from Malinga. Slung up quick and straight. Trott digs out and looks urgently for one which isn't there. Good signs from him though
Trott is playing really well here, this time driving sweetly through cover
Morgan very watchful in defence. He seems like he's  been focussing on defence but he's 16 off 18
driven through cover this time easily enough
bouncer shoved  down short,  Trott has plenty of time to crouch under it
slower ball this time but Trott seemed like he read it easily
Trott defends quietly off the front foot
Trott hurries back this time to defend, but can't pick a gap
this time he eases it down the ground to get the single he was after
Randiv always finds more bounce than expected and this thuds off the thigh
excellent work from Randiv, top spinner here dips on Trott as he tries to run away to third man. Nips an inside edge and bobbles away for a single
careful defence from Morgan to end a good comeback over from Randiv
starts well, tossing one up around leg stump. Trott leans forward to block
this time it's much too short but spins quite a long way. Trott is hanging back and waits an age to drag  a pull shot down the ground
Morgan is back to try and work this to  leg, too much spin means he misses
ah the reverse-thwack of Morgan's. Always so satisfying! Gets a full toss and lands the shot perfectly, beating short fine leg  to take the boundary
this time he works with the spin into space on the leg side
googly to Trott, he seems to read it and waits causally on the back foot to work to leg
Randiv is harder to sweep because of the bounce he finds, Trott is trying to reverse sweep here and misses entirely. So does the keeper
slow, loopy and some bounce too means Morgan doesn't get much of the attempted sweep
little bit short from Randiv and Morgan hops back to cut
Trott is happily in his Trott bubble now, working a single to midwicket with the spin
Morgan forward to clip a single off his toes

hesitation and misunderstanding!  Yes, no, no, maybe, yes and as Trott worked to short fine leg. If the throw had been even half decent it would have been out at the bowler's end but Sri Lanka have fielded badly all day
pushed down the ground for an easy single
touch short from Mendis and Morgan drags his pull shot down to long-on
blocked firmly back to the bowler
Trott gets deep into his crease to cut to deep cover
Morgan misses a leg-side fiddle. Which is unusual
this is short enough for Morgan to get back and shovel down the ground
Randiv is short and Morgan pulls spinner better than most. Malinga has fielder and bowled pretty awfully today and his effort here, slide-tackling the ball, is curious
pushed into space for a single
some extra bounce and spin almost creeps through the gate here from outside off
Trott hops down the wicket to try and push a single down the ground but the bowler collects
ooh, again this is through the gate! So close to off stump as Trott aimed an expansive drive
pushed to midwicket to end an interesting over. Real spin for Randiv
Morgan reverse sweeps, but the ball goes in front of square and is stopped on the deep cover boundary
looped up very slowly by Mendis, Trott hangs back and punches through cover for a couple
pitched up very full, Trott eases the ball to long-on for a single
wrong 'un from Mendis, but it's picked early and cracked through extra cover
forced away to the cover sweeper for one more
Morgan waits on the back foot and sends the ball down to long-on for one, England ticking along nicely
chipped out to wide long-off, no flourish from Morgan but the ball really pinged off the bat
a little flatter, but there's still flight there and Morgan defends
pitched right up on off stump, Morgan comes forward and drives hard out into the deep
Trott shifts his weight back to pick up yet another single
cut hard out to deep point, Mathews sprints round and slides to save runs
tapped in front of midwicket
not all that short but very slow indeed, and so Morgan can hop back and pull to deep midwicket
punched firmly to the fielder inside the ring at midwicket
Morgan reverse-sweeps through point for a single
tossed up on middle and off, Trott drives down to long-off
and Morgan follows suit, pushing the ball down the ground off the front foot
the googly, but it slips out very wide of off and is easily dealt with by Trott
flighted on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
pushed to long off for one
tapped into space on the leg side, they sprint the first run very hard, but there's no chance of a second
eased to long on, and Trott is one run closer to his fifty
Morgan hops back, moving his feet very quickly, to get the ball away through cover point
no run to be had this time, Trott stepping back and nurdling to the man at midwicket
the wrong 'un from Mendis, Morgan bent his knees and set himself to thrash him through the leg side, but didn't time it too well and found the man at midwicket
driven down the ground to long-off
tossed up nicely on off stump, Trott defends
a touch too straight, milked down to long-on
some sharp spin for Mendis and Morgan is hit on the pad, definitely heading well down leg. He also may have got a touch on it
and there's the fifty, fluent stuff from Trott as he drives to wide long-off
slung well wide of off stump, the ball flashes past Trott's outside edge and curves through the air on its way to Sangakkara
a touch of drift in through the air as Malinga lands one very full on middle, but nothing dramatic so far
timing! Trott punches down the ground, and the fielder at mid-on makes a hash of his attempt to stop the shot
pushed down the ground again, mid-on has been pushed back and manages to stop this one
definite curve through the air, leaving the left-hander, and Morgan re-adjusts his defence at the last moment ... and they sneak a single as the ball dribbles into the off side
very quick and swinging in towards the off stump, Trott digs it out to point
looped up slowly from round the wicket, Morgan taps gently into the vast spaces on the leg side and they're through for an easy single as Dilshan races after the  ball
there's a pleading, emotive appeal from Dilshan as Trott bends into a reverse sweep, but that looks to have come off the face of the bat and the glove!
flicked out into the leg side, and that's England's 200
driven to long-on for one
Morgan hops back and cuts, but the point fielder negates thoughts of a run
not this time! Morgan picks up a single in front of point to go to fifty. Trott wanders down to shake his hand
slower ball from Malinga, but it's spotted by Morgan, who drives out to deep cover
pitched up on off stump, Trott drives but hits the field
another slower one, Trott props half forward and squeezes the ball through point for one
hammered to midwicket! Malinga tried to test Morgan with the bouncer but he was more than equal to the task, leaning back and slapping the ball hard in front of square
Malinga adjusts his length and Morgan digs out a full delivery towards mid-off
full, swinging yorker, but it still brings a single as Morgan flicks to leg and midwicket can only parry the ball
Morgan flicks his wrists over a full delivery on middle and leg to send the ball to deep midwicket
reverse paddle from Trott, and they ... trot back for the second
too straight from Dilshan, Trott keeps his weight back and works with the turn into the leg side

well, where's that come from? Morgan walks down the wicket but doesn't get close to a flat offspinner from Dilshan, the ball buzzing past the outside edge and Sangakkara quickly whipping the bails off. Against the run of play, Sri Lanka have got the breakthrough. It's timely too, Morgan would surely have looked to up the tempo sooner rather than later
pushed back to the bowler
tapped defensively to leg to end the over
possibly the slowest ball of the day, really looped up and Trott defends off the front foot
he comes forward this time, nudging through mid-on
Bell could well have left this and picked up an off-side wide, but would rather get off the mark, cutting out into the deep
Trott stays on the back foot to punch through extra cover
slapped through cover point once again
a low full toss is whipped off the toes to midwicket
Trott hangs back, as his his way, and threads through a gap at point
ha, Bell almost launched himself off his feet with an almighty thwack. He missed though and the ball stuck in the pitch
this time with much less fuss he clips down the ground
Trott pushes a defence back to the bowler
if England hadn't had such a good start this would be a problem, but because they flew to begin with it's fine. Trott reverse sweeps with little distinction around the corner
Bell nudges a single behind square on the leg side as Dilshan finds some decent turn

Bell skips down the wicket and chips straight to long-on! Timed it better than he wanted to I guess but it makes for another failure down the order for Bell. Doesn't look a natural No. 6 at all, largely because he isn't one
Trott misses a leg-side nudge but it runs off the inside edge onto the pads down to fine leg. Sprightly Samit hares back for a third!
carefully blocked first ball. Wristily though

oh dear, what's Samit done!? Look's like Trott is home but that's not at all in Patel's script. It was flicked to the leg side, set off for one and Trott wanted a second but Patel sent him back late. Needed a desperate dive to get home. Trott was not at all amused
driven down the ground for a single, Trott very loud in his calling
Patel keeps the strike by turning his wrists over the ball to midwicket
careful defence from the front foot as Dilshan lands it around middle
pushed through quicker from Dilshan and Patel can't find a gap
Dilshan rushing through his over and joining the dots as Patel picks out midwicket
finally Patel can turn it off his pads into a gap behind square
Trott clumps straight back at the bowler who parries the take
arrowed down the leg side
flipped around for a single but that's a good over from Dilshan
big appeal from behind the wicket as Trott misses another leg-side fiddle, runs off the pads into the leg side but it looked a good shout
Patel securely pushes a single to point

gone! How odd is this!? It was a touch short from Randiv, bounced more than Trott thought as he tried to pull, came off the thigh, then onto his arm and rolled down onto the stumps. Trott tried to kick it away but couldn't get there
Bresnan starts with a solid drive straight to cover
not sure this field is right, very deep set and Bresnan helps himself to a single to get himself off the mark
blocked securely to end the over
Bresnan tickles a single into the midwicket area. With the field as it is he gets a single
Patel advances with quick feet but can't beat the bowler with his drive
flipped away to midwicket for a single
Bresnan lines this up outside off stump and opts to leave. Building an innings, clearly
driven hard but straight back at the bowler
this time Bresnan manages to clump a single down the ground but Dilshan is doing a good job now. Still doesn't atone for his nonsense at the start of the innings
ah, Lasith loves it at the death. It's almost like the whole period leading up to it is a drag. Now he's full, fast, swinging it in and at the toes
yorker is slightly overegged into a full toss and Bresnan forces it out wide of deep midwicket
another inswinging yorker homing in at the toes. Bresnan clears his legs out the way to dig back to the bowler
a third yorker, quick too. Bresnan gets a solid bat on this but straight to short cover
low full toss but Bresnan can't get it away. Finds a toe-end that goes straight to short midwicket
great over! Just two runs from it. Ends with another low-full toss, swinging in. Bresnan toe-ends to midwicket
starts with a short ball that Patel gets deep into his crease to swat down the ground
too wide this time, Patel hops back and cracks a cut shot out to deep point
short ball pulled to midwicket and dropped!  Dilshan is the culprit. Would have been a sparkling take, diving high to his right

Patel goes now! Randiv has another, England stumbling! The building pressure told for him. Tried to break the shackles with a big shot down the ground but only managed to slice it up to cover where Mathews juggled the take, he's really got terrible hands!
Bresnan blocks solidly to point, thinks about a single before Swann sends him back
five for Randiv! England in a spin again! This is really laboured from Bresnan. He tried to drag a pull but ended up with one hand off the bat and a gentle top edge that looped simply to Sangakkara
Swann very careful, digging out a yorker with a low back lift
another inch-perfect inswinging yorker. Swann not trying anything more than surviving
somehow Swann gets this down to fine leg, help of an inside edge. Swann gambled the throw would be poor and came back for a second
Swann will be disappointed with this, couldn't get a length ball through the covers
big inswing again at a full length beats Swann's attempted tickle and lands on his back boot. Malinga appealed but knew it was heading well down
Anderson does well to keep this yorker out but another brilliant over. England going nowhere!
Swann dances down and forces to long-on, only gets one which brings Anderson on strike straight away
Anderson attempts to reverse sweep a ball well outside off, wasn't a bad option but he missed
this time he drives languidly but powerlessly to point
swish and a miss outside off stump. Swann is stuck at the wrong end and Dilshan is delighted
big cheer from his home crowd as Anderson connects well on the sweep, again England challenge the fielder's throw by coming back for a second
another play and miss outside off stump
we all know what Malinga's doing but keeping it out is the tough bit. Scoring is even harder. Swann digs it out once more
with a careful drive Swann brings up England's 250. Thank goodness for the quick start!
bonus for England as Malinga overdoes a yorker and serves up a shin-high full toss that Anderson pushes through cover
slower ball that Swann seems to see at the last moment. He's always happy on the drive and plays it hard to point
cracking yorker, tailing away at the last moment. Anderson holds his bat in line to defend
this swings back into Anderson, past the attempted flip to leg, bounces off the pads to point and England risk a single. If the throw had hit Anderson would have gone
oh dear! Anderson was so desperate to get Swann on strike that he pushed to cover and shaped to run, Swann had gone too far and when the throw came at the bowler's end Swann couldn't get back in time
driven firmly but straight to deep cover. England should just take what they can from here, no point trying to find the boundary
Dernbach doesn't seem a type short on confidence. He gives himself room to clump a single down the ground
this is useful for Anderson! Down the wicket and hacks into the leg side. Came off the toe-end but got enough of it to collect a couple
this is wide of off and stabbed to cover for another single
Dernbach aims an lofted extra-cover drive... but misses. He might have been better served by just getting bat on ball
Anderson advances and aims a drive, gets a toe-end to cover and runs swiftly enough to get home despite a direct hit. Good job all round

that's a shocker from Malinga. Dernbach gave himself room and Malinga followed him down the leg side a long, long way. It took a magnificent dive from Sangakkara to stop four. Malinga should have backed himself to hit the stumps!
more useful runs for England, Anderson clips this off his toes with sweet timing, it's straight of deep midwicket and collects three
Dernbach clumps down the ground and runs straight down the middle of the pitch, earning him an official warning
Anderson again works to leg for a single. This has been an excellent over for England
inside edge runs down to fine leg. Crucial runs, Dernbach may not know how but they are important
so no dot balls from the last over, England scrap up to 268, useful 10th-wicket stand at the end

inn2.comm: on a length, leaving the offspinner through the air, and he leaves his first ball in international cricket alone
fuller and wider still ... it's close to being a wide, but not quite. Another leave
Anderson plugs away on a length outside off, Karunaratne shoulders arms once more
and he's away, and in some style. Karunaratne picks up his first international runs by driving on the up to send the ball behind square on the off side
this one keeps a little low, nipping under the bat as Karunaratne swished without much intent outside off
past the top edge this time! Again Karunaratne was looking to cut, this time the bounce was true and the ball burst past the bat
he takes one on the hip to start, looking to glance to leg and missing
full and wide, Dilshan slaps it down past a diving point fielder and third man sprints round to cut it off
movement in to the right-hander off the seam, and Dilshan clips to square leg

a thick edge flies to Trott at first slip, Bresnan has the breakthrough! Bresnan slammed one down just short of a good length on off stump, Karunaratne's feet were set in concrete as he pushed limply at the ball and the edge nestled safely in Trott's lap
on a length and straight, Sangakkara nudges to leg
the ball squirts through gully off a thick edge, and Sangakkara is off the mark
wobbling around on middle and leg, Sangakkara gets across and taps to midwicket
Sangakkara steps half forward and angles the bat to get the ball down to third man
worked off middle, the ball rolling down to fine leg
solid, crunchy defence from Sangakkara as Anderson aims one at the off stump
punched to point on the walk, the fielder cutting the shot off
an inside edge shoots just past the stumps! Anderson has his hands on his head as the ball rolls down to fine leg, and they're back for the second
Bresnan keeps Dilshan on the back foot, the ball trickling into the covers

hooked straight to Dernbach at fine leg! The ball was short and rising on leg stump, Dilshan swivelled across and got a great connection but hit it right down the fielder's throat, he didn't have to move. So similar to his dismissal in the first match of this very series, and Sri Lanka are in a spot of bother at 12 for 2
on a length and holding its line outside off, Jayawardene leaves alone
pushed neatly through cover point to get off the mark, the well-balanced shot of a man in form
Jayawardene gets right across to off to defend a length delivery to cover
short on off stump, Jayawardene is quickly onto the back foot and pulls in the air in front of square, the ball plugging in the outfield at deep midwicket
short of a good length on leg stump, Sangakkara rides the bounce to get the ball to fine leg
sharp movement off a great length! Jayawardene was stuck on the crease as this one seamed back in to him, taking a thick edge and rolling behind square
Sangakkara steps forward to drive but doesn't come close to timing it
this one kept slightly low, and Sangakkara jabbed down quite late in defence
that's timed! Sangakkara bends very low, settling on one knee to send the ball racing to the square boundary. Real class in the stroke
Anderson responds by pulling his length back, Sangakkara defending off the back foot
whipped off the pads and down to fine leg
very full on off stump, Sangakkara's bottom hand comes into the shot as he pushes to mid-on
tapped through square leg for a single
brilliant stop! Jayawardene cuts but Morgan leaps athletically to his left, stopping the ball in mid-air

from the sublime to ... dropped by Dernbach at fine leg! Jayawardene lifted one off his pads and Dernbach needed only to take a few steps forward to get to the ball, which he did, but it hit the hand hard and popped out
quiet defence to end an eventful over
Jayawardene works his wrists over a length delivery, sending the ball behind square on the leg side
edged, but short of Swann at slip! A true edge off the bat, but there wasn't much carry off the pitch and the ball dropped some inches in front of the fielder
Sangakkara comes forward to defend to extra cover
chopped defensively to cover point, Sangakkara forward once again
angled down to third man for a single
Jayawardene stays back to defend to leg
nudged just wide of Patel at midwicket, and they take a quick single
a lifter outside off! There's that variable bounce again. Fortunately for Jayawardene, he had already drawn his bat inside the line to leave
Jayawardene steps half forward to defend a length ball to point
Jayawardene guides to third man for a single
Sangakkara looks for the single through gully, but Morgan is across in a flash
pushed firmly towards extra cover off the back foot, Anderson the man to stop it with a dive and a roll
on a length on off stump, solid defence from Mahela

chipped tamely to Alastair Cook at mid-off! Jayawardene was trying to go over the top, but a full delivery stopped in the pitch and bounced a little more than expected and Cook backpeddled to hold an easy catch. Sri Lanka in real trouble now, 29 for 3 and two of their best batsmen in the pavilion
rising off a length, Chandimal was thinking of leaving it but didn't get the bat out of the way in time, the ball going to slip after a couple of bounces
fuller and straighter, Chandimal comes forward to defend
clipped just wide of the midwicket fielder, and there's room for a quick single
fetched wristily into the leg side, but straight to midwicket
Dernbach tests Chandimal with a short one, but he 's back in a flash to slap it hard over square leg for four. Good connection, and a nice sound off the bat
shortish once again, Chandimal goes back to defend
this one nips into the right-hander off the pitch, and he's cramped for room as he taps to gully
defended to extra cover, Chandimal presenting the full face of the bat
punched firmly in front of point, Morgan dives to his right to stop the shot
another crisp stroke goes to Morgan, on the bounce, and he's right behind it again
Bresnan gets a change of ends and starts very straight. Sangakkara is solid in defence
whatever soft drinks the crowd have been guzzling have clearly taken effect, they are in full voice. Sangakkara is again defending crisply
third time in a row Bresnan hammers done on a length, forcing Sangakkara to defend off the back foot to cover
hanging legside of the ball this is chopped down to third man
Bresnan gets his line slightly wrong and it clips off the thigh pad down to the fine-leg boundary. Patel hares around and slides but can't quite catch up with the ball
Chandimal is a very clean striker off the ball and seems to have a very uncluttered mind too. This is wonderful, as he skips down a couple of steps and clatters this cleanly down the ground for six
Dernbach offers a hint of width that Sangakkara drives at but can't beat the infield
excellent timing from Sangakkara. So crisply flicked off the toes, just wide of mid-on and it flew to the boundary
Dernbach is shorter in response but the line allows a single to be knocked off the hip around the corner

the slower ball worked well for Dernbach here, just kicked off a length, found a glove that looped with of Kieswetter and, oddly enough, ran to the rope. Neither the pitch nor outfield seemed quick enough
Anderson pounces on the ball at cover to cut off this well-timed drive. He really is an incredibly agile bowler
slower ball again does for Chandimal but this time he plays and misses
Sangakkara clips off his pads to give Chandimal back the strike
shoved down very short from Bresnan. Down the leg side, too
good delivery here, back of a length, into the corridor
without wanting to get all Shastri on you, when Chandimal hits them, they stay hit. Really does hammer the ball. Expects a length delivery here, so clears his front leg and mullers it to cow corner
after that excitement he gets forward in perfect defence
again Chandimal is down the wicket, gives himself some room and laces a drive to cover. Bresnan has a chirp but Chandimal just smiles back at him

Bresnan is still chipping away but Chandimal's England is patchy. He again smiles broadly back at him after flicking a single behind square. He's bubbling with confidence and ability, really exciting prospect
starts with a low-armed slider back into the batsman who blocks down the ground. Patel dives with a flourish to field
this is again aiming for off stump and defended quietly
touch more air on this and Chandimal blocks
Chandimal drives down the ground with a very straight bat. He blends very orthodox shots with his clean striking
Sangakkara classily knocks into the leg side
excellent first over from Patel. No great spin or anything but a tight line from a low arm at a good pace. Chandimal blocks
touch of width here angled across the left-hander from wide of the crease. Driven hard but straight to point
slower ball this time and Sangakkara waits on it before guiding to cover
ah lovely shot, Dernbach wide of the crease creating an angle that Sangakkara uses to drive wonderfully through the covers
Dernbach returns to a good line and forces good defence
Sangakkara deceived by the slower ball but the inside edge runs down to fine leg
he normally hits them cleanly but Chandimal didn't quite get all of this slower ball. Clears his front leg out the way and again bashes it, just over the infield, to the boundary
Patel continues to find a good line and Sangakkara knocks it down the ground
hint of a mix-up as Chandimal knocks to midwicket looking for one that wasn't there
shortish delivery that's chopped firmly to deep point
Patel holds a decent line outside off stump, Sangakkara forward in defence
enough width here for Sangakkara to cut firmly, behind point
nicely-judged single to end the over. Tip and run as it's pushed to cover
starts flat and back of a spinner's good length. Sangakkara waits on the back foot and nibbles a single around the corner. How will Chandimal play Swann?
...with due respect first up, carefully defended
aw that's incredible. Chandimal hares down the ground and with a big arc crashes this down the ground for a monstrous six
plenty of ability, plenty. Keeps things very simple and keeps smiling. Very carefully pushes a single down the ground
with the kid up to tricks at one end, the master is fiddling singles at the other. Good combination

clever bowling from Swann, pushed through quicker, flatter and wider of off in case Chandimal was running down. In the end the batsman blocked firmly back at Swann who neatly flicked it behind him onto the stumps but Sangakkara was aware enough to dive back into his ground. Smart work all round
Patel continues his slingy left-arm spinners and Sangakkara neatly pushes him down the ground
up and around off stump and Chandimal pushes a single to the off side
the strike exchanges once again with a single milked down the ground
smart bowling here did Chandimal in the flight I think, he ended up having to flick alarmingly to midwicket
carefully defended this time
Chandimal presses forward before getting back and punching down the ground
Swann offers Chandimal some air outside off stump. The batsman blocks
slower and a touch shorter, clipped to midwicket
ripping turn for Swann here, just holding it back a fraction. Chandimal pushed forward but it spun past his inside edge
and again Chandimal is beaten by some big spin. Dots joining now
after popping forward for a couple Chandimal stays back. Swann is keeping it well outside off and spinning it back sharply. Poked to midwicket
lovely over and an excellent little battle that. Swann superb
Sangakkara pushes to cover in defence
got mini period building for England now as some good fielding at midwicket prevents Sangakkara getting a single for his punch
blocked back to the bowler carefully
finally the sequence of dots is broken as Sangakkara punches through cover
Chandimal rotates the strike straight away by driving firmly down the ground
Patel unable to dive to stop this drive down the ground
Swann round the wicket to Sangakkara and flat and straight
Swann just pushing it through and cramping Sangakkara for space
this is slower, with more flight. The line remains ideal and Sangakkara leans forward in defence
another dot for Swann, he's bowling beautifully
very straight again but with enough air and slow enough to be tempting. Sangakkara resists
another brilliant over, Sangakkara reasons attacking Swann in conditions like this isn't worth the risk
pressure building and Chandimal just tried to manufacture something here. Gets well across his stumps to guide a sweep around the corner. Didn't look entirely certain but gets a couple for it
Chandimal drives very hard back at Patel who slightly absent-mindedly went down with one hand to field and parried it
dipping full toss that Chandimal drives hard back down the ground
good shot for one here as Sangakkara really nails his sweep shot to deep square
good batting from Chandimal to bring up the Sri Lanka hundred. Just pushes to point and races down
Sangakkara finishes off the over with a clip down the ground
finally a run off Swann, it's come after two maidens from him. Sangakkara back and punching to long-on
Swann has got the better of Chandimal at the moment, holding it back and spinning it a long way from outside off. Chandimal forward but uncertain as he tries to defend
after all that pressure Chandimal runs down the track but calmly pushes a single down the ground
Sangakkara anchoring things nicely, clipping singles into space
Chandimal stretches across to the off side to try and work a single to leg, but can't beat the fielder. He's struggling for scoring options against Swann
ooh, beaten! This line wide of off is really bothering Chandimal. Aims an enormous sweep but ends up hacking at thin air
really interesting watching this pressure develop. Sangakkara aims a huge swipe but it trickles off the toe-end to midwicket
ooh, play and a miss again! Outside off Sangakkara aims a sweep but misses. Kieswetter gets excited about a stumping attempt but for no real reason. Pressure though, pressure building
Sangakkara picks out cover with a firmly struck drive. Sri Lanka need to keep their heads here
Sangakkara finally eases things with a single down the ground
Chandimal rushes down the track and almost ends up yorking himself. Had to block out at the last moment
the line is slightly wrong and though Chandimal misses a sweep it clips the pads and runs away towards fine leg
neatly done by Sangakkara, edging down the wicket, meeting this on the half-volley and clipping a single down to long-on

well, something had to give between Swann and Chandimal. Really the batsman was lucky here, it was a thick inside edge as he ran down the wicket and swung wildly, got enough of it to go wide of long-on for four
after the boundary Chandimal can revert more comfortably to defence
and again it's quietly defended to midwicket. Chandimal is desperate for one but there isn't one available
again it's pushed to midwicket with Sangakkara calling loudly against the idea of a run
quicker ball is slightly overdone and Chandimal can more happily push a single down the ground
Dernbach starts with a quick delivery angling in to Chandimal who tries to squeeze a cut shot. Too tight for the shot really
ooh, again Chandimal squeezes a cut but this was off middle stump pretty much. Got enough of it to move to 49 with a steer to third man
Sangakkara knocks away a single with a turn of the wrists and a minimum of fuss
Dernbach jumps wide of the crease and angles this in. Chandimal drives sweetly but straight to cover

fifty for Chandimal and it's an excellent one, coming in a situation of intense pressure. He's suitably delighted and earns a big hug from his partner. Reaches the landmark  by flicking a full toss wide of midwicket
similar area again here, but this time Chandimal flicks it in the air. Perfectly safe though
Swann is angling it in with the arm from around the wicket, Sangakkara gets deep into his crease to fiddle a single behind square
some late drift just caused Chandimal to change his stroke here, he wanted to go straight initially but ended up driving through extra cover
Swann gets his line slightly wrong here, which is rare and it slides down the leg side past Kieswetter

Swann gets his man! It's been a fantastic battle but Swann gets the better of it in the end. Chandimal hared down the track, the drift and dip took it wider than he imagined and he swung wildly at thin air as the ball past him by to leave him stranded
carefully defended first up
this time Mathews coolly knocks into space
neatly pushed into a gap
a loose push outside off from the left-hander, and some curve away through the air takes the ball past the bat. Is that a touch of reverse?
fuller this time, and Sangakkara sends the ball out to deep cover off the front foot
full and wide outside off, Mathews leans across and leaves alone
Mathews shoulders arms once more, he's in no rush just yet
Mathews perhaps in two minds as to whether to play this one, he thrusts the bat out weakly and is beaten on the outside edge
this one he definitely has played at, but it makes no difference as once again Dernbach passes the outside edge.
tossed up on off stump from around the wicket, defended down the track
nudged wide of mid-on for a single
slightly awkward defence from Mathews, as he's not quite sure what to do with one that goes straight on with the arm
nudged to square leg, they take a single but they've got to scramble
pushed down the ground for a single
Mathews stretches well forward to defend
he aims full outside off to start, and Sri Lanka get a single as Sangakkara pushes down the ground, mid-off sprinting round but unable to stop the run
the bouncer has Mathews in some trouble! Dug in short by Bresnan, the batsman perhaps not expecting the ball to get up as quickly as it did on this slow pitch. He had to duck quite hastily there
a hint of seam movement as Bresnan pitches this one up, defended to leg
back of a length on off stump, Mathews stands at the crease to defend
Bresnan slips towards leg stump and Mathews sends the ball down to fine leg with a paddled pull

gone! Chopped on, Sangakkara falls and Bresnan is ecstatic. He was trying to chop the ball down towards third man but it was just too close to him for the shot, the ball cannoning off the inside edge into the stumps. Sangakkara trudges off, and that will tip the scales firmly in England's favour
he comes round the wicket to Mathews, who pushes back to the bowler
tapped to cover, Mathews wants the single but it's not on
driven back to the bowler once again
speared towards leg stump, the ball hits the pad and Mendis calls him through
decent flight outside off, Mendis presses forward in defence
a little too short to end the over, Mendis hops back and slaps to deep cover
just short of a good length, good bounce and Mendis defends off the back foot
beaten on the outside edge! The length was really good this time, and the angle and seam movement took the ball away from Mendis' nervous push
clipped into the leg side, just the one
a controlled paddle-pull sends the ball rolling to deep midwicket
Mendis gets right across to off and nudges to leg
Mathews leans over the ball and sends it rolling to long leg with a flick of the wrists
Mathews shimmies out to turn this into a low full toss and drives to long-on
... and Mendis does the same, using his feet and driving a full toss into the leg side
eased down to long-off, Mathews playing off the front foot
turned with the spin to midwicket, straight to the fielder
Mendis advances down the track and whips to wide long-on
arrowed down the leg side, Mathews glances down to fine leg and it has the beating of the fielder
Mendis stretches forward to defend the loosener to extra cover
pitched up once again outside off, Mendis drives but there's minimal timing in the shot
nudged off the hip to square leg
Anderson aims full on off stump, but Mathews gets the bat in line to defend
Mathews jumps out and slices a drive, the ball looping over backward point and rolling to third man
Mendis slashes hard, the ball takes a thick edge and flies past a leaping Kieswetter! That wasn't too far away, and Mendis is now also copping an earful from an annoyed Anderson
full, driven hard back at the bowler
driven down to long-on, just the single
Dernbach comes round the wicket, Mendis getting right across to the off side and wearing one on the thigh as he attempts to tuck to leg ... they take a leg-bye
slower ball, Mathews drops it close on the leg side and they steal a single
slower again, and very full and wide this time. Mendis throws the bat at it and squeezes it past a diving point fielder
another looping slower ball, Mendis is too early into the drive and the ball rolls slowly to Cook in the leg side
Mathews whips a low full toss out to deep square. He timed it well, but aimed straight at the fielder
Mendis swivels on one leg as he pulls out to deep midwicket
full on off stump and Mathews drives down the ground
speared down the leg side by Bresnan, Mendis just needs to get a touch on it to pick up four to a very fine leg
this time Mendis stands up tall to pull down to fine leg, and Dernbach has to sprint across to stop the boundary
there's a big appeal from Bresnan as ball hits pad, but that looks like it pitched well outside leg
Mathews is supposed to be a very dangerous player and deals with this very easily, clipping a leg-side half-volley to the midwicket boundary
slower ball is Dernbach's response, as you would expect. Prodded to the leg side
wide of the crease from around the wicket, Mendis defends back solidly
driven without great timing down the ground
Dernbach has been whole-hearted and largely ineffective and again he's pushed quietly down the ground
clipped with soft hands into the leg side
everything about Bresnan is solid and reliable, he's England's best ODI quick bowler. This full ball is knocked down the ground
Mathews manages to drive  this wide enough of long-off  to get a couple
with midwicket on the ring Mathews can collect a single
full toss slashed wide of a diving Morgan at point for four. Brings up the fifty stand, come off 46 balls
after the boundary comes a firmly-struck punch to cover
Mendis turns his hands over the ball to knock it into the leg side. Makes it a good over for Sri Lanka
Dernbach lands a trademark slower ball and Mendis can't beat the infield
that will do nicely for the batsman! Dernbach finds the edge that goes wide of a diving Kieswetter and slips away for four
slower ball is the response and Mendis waits on it and drives down the ground
lovely work from Mathews, steering a single to point with soft, soft hands
full ball is blocked back to the bowler
driven firmly back at the bowler again, who collects neatly in his follow through
Anderson returns and starts by sliding a wide down the leg side
this almost heads in the same direction but Mathews manages to intervene with a fine fiddle
flicked to deep square without a hint of fuss
Mathews edges down the track so Anderson bangs it in short, in the end it's clipped wide of deep square for a couple
full, straight and driven down the ground to rotate the strike again
sweetly driven but straight to Patel at cover, who fumbles the take
this was a very risky second run as Mendis nudged to midwicket, Kieswetter ended up kicking the stumps before he collected but if he didn't it might have been tight
Swann starts well, up around off stump and it's angled around the corner
clipped to midwicket this time, Mathews wants two but one is all that's available
touch short from Swann and Mendis leans back to chop to deep point
pushed to cover quietly, no great risk but enough for a single. That's exactly what Sri Lanka need to do
and again a single is fiddled into space, no width for the batsmen to work with but nudging gets them to 200
nothing from the last ball, the required rate pushing up above 7.5
Mendis on the reverse swipe, doesn't connect and is struck on the pads close to off stump
carefully defended into the off side

Kieswetter is convinced he has his man as Mendis shapes to reverse sweep, before leaving it. The leg twitched and Kieswetter had the bail off but the foot was grounded. That said, it should have been given a wide
after all the excitement Mendis hurries down the track to work a single to leg
powerfully struck by Mathews! Just nipped down the track, met it on the full and drove firmly through cover for four

that's better, much better! Look out England! Brilliant shot from Mathews. Opened his body to bring the off side into play and drove beautifully, all along the ground through cover, piercing the field perfectly
Swann is so accurate with length and line and Mendis can't find a gap
the drift just got Mendis is trouble here as he advanced, came back into him so he ended up flicking squarer than he hoped but placed it well
Mendis pops forward to defend, thinks about a single but has to dive back as Kieswetter runs, collects and flicks back at the stumps
chipped again to deep midwicket, well placed and they ran very hard, challenging Pietersen's throw and winning the battle
Mendis lined up very early to reverse-sweep and though he didn't strike it perfectly got enough of it to get a single away
very calmly done by Mathews, quietly knocking a single to square leg. Swann is just getting tense with his fielders here, England, with their new captain are in a real scrap
good start from Mathews against the new spell, forcing a full ball down the ground, wide of long-on for a couple
Mathews shaped up to Dil-scoop because nobody is behind square on the leg side, Anderson saw him and shoved it down too short for it so Mathews stood up, pushed to cover and skipped through for one
hit hard from Mendis down the ground, he thought for a moment he could beat long-on but Pietersen swooped round in time
late swing here back to Mathews from Anderson, yorker length too. Driven back at the bowler
Mathews missed out here. Anderson overdid his yorker into a full toss and Mathews swung hard into the leg side but got mostly an inside edge that trickled to deep midwicket
excellent over from Anderson, one of best death overs in a long time. Lands a yorker that Mendis does well to squeeze out
Mathews content to nurdle Swann at this stage, carefully working a single to leg
Mendis is lucky to get away with this! Swann throws it up slowly and it dips on the batsman, booming drive attempted but sliced to deep cover
blocked back to the bowler, pressure mounting all of a sudden
ooh, almost a mix-up here as Mathews tries to work a single to leg. He wanted one but it was never there and was sent back
only a single for Mathews, not trying anything silly against Swann
Swann's job for the day is done, excellent spell from him. Mendis carefully pushes a single down the ground. Sri Lanka are going to have to have a dart soon
good delivery, full and straight. Mendis manages to force down the ground
top bowling from Anderson, lands a slower ball excellently. Mendis tries to run it past the keeper but can't
somehow Mathews gets power on this drive from a yorker length, very swift running turned it into a much-needed couple

fantastic batting to bring up the 100 stand! Anderson gets his length slightly wrong and Mathews gets all of leg-side clip, timing it brilliantly and bisecting the two deep-set fielders. Brings up his fifty too!
slower ball again from Anderson, Mathews gave himself room to chop to third man but got too much and steered to deep point
over ends with Mendis squeezing out a drive through cover all along the ground. Good over for the tourists getting nine

Mendis falls trying to clear the boundary! England strike gold with Patel. Mendis was down the track trying to smear Patel over cow corner, didn't get enough of it and Pietersen waited coolly underneath to pouch the chance!
Mathews gets well outside leg to open out the off side and Bell's misfield at cover allows him to come back for a second
wonderful stuff again from Mathews! Gets down the track and leg side of the ball, picks a gap between deep cover and long-off and drives sweetly to the boundary
ah, after shots as good as the one before why try to reverse sweep!?
smart bowling from Patel, quicker ball that Mathews guides into the off side for a single

Kulasekara drives his first ball stylishly down the ground to take a single that keeps the strike. Patel is done for the day and his last over was a good one. The game is still very tight and it's the big three pacemen to finish off
slower ball from Anderson to Kulasekara on a good length, the batsman eases a drive through cover to bring Mathews back to the business end
oof Anderson gets away with this! Full ball, swinging into the pads with fine leg up. Just flicked the pad but got enough of it to take the pace off
slower ball bouncer is swung away to deep midwicket but it's just a couple. Sri Lanka need a boundary this over
Kulasekara has gone! Another slower ball is swung out to deep midwicket, Eoin Morgan looking into the sun steadies himself under it and takes the catch. Dot ball, too

panic from Sri Lanka! Randiv has gone without facing a ball! Mathews drove nicely out to deep cover and Randiv desperately wanted to come back for a second, Mathews didn't have any of it and the batsmen ended up at the same end, eventually Randiv turned back but far too late
shot! Shot Malinga! What a strike! He's just waltzed down the track and crashed this a mile into the stands over long-on! That's changed the things completely!

slower ball has done for Mathews! Dernbach screams to the heavens! Great delivery! Mathews was completely deceived, played much too early, lost one hand off the bat and it looped to Bresnan at short third man who held on. Brilliant innings but it might not be enough

bowled him! Dernbach is appealing at first but realises soon enough he's won the match for England! Spearing yorker bursts under the bat and rattles the stumps! England go wild, the crowd goes wild! Cook has pulled off victory in his first series as full-time captain
